intro: Gyrotaenia trujilloana, commonly known as the Trujilloan gyrotaenia, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous roots. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
